mnemonic: BOM sounds like BOMB - a GOOD bomb of flavor!
grammar_notes: Masculine singular. Irregular: bom/boa not bono/bona.
cultural_note: 'Bom dia!' uses masculine because 'dia' (day) is masculine in Portuguese.

mnemonic: BOA sounds like BOW-AH - take a BOW for something good!
grammar_notes: Feminine singular of bom. Changes completely not just ending.
cultural_note: 'Boa tarde' 'Boa noite' - feminine because tarde/noite are feminine nouns.
tip: Feminine form - used with feminine nouns

mnemonic: MAU sounds like MOW - MOWing is BAD (tedious work)!
grammar_notes: Masculine singular. Irregular like bom - mau/má.
cultural_note: 'Mau tempo' (bad weather) - you'll hear this a lot in winter!

mnemonic: MÁ is short - just 'mah' - SHORT and BAD!
grammar_notes: Feminine singular of mau. Very short word.

mnemonic: GRANDE sounds like GRAND - GRAND things are BIG!
grammar_notes: Same form for masculine and feminine. Position can change meaning.
cultural_note: 'Um grande homem' (a great man) vs 'um homem grande' (a big/tall man).

mnemonic: PEQUENO = peh-KAY-no - a tiny KAYAK is SMALL!
cultural_note: 'O pequeno-almoço' (breakfast - literally 'small lunch') is an important meal!

mnemonic: PEQUENA ends in A - feminine small!
cultural_note: 'Uma pequena pausa' (a small break) - Portuguese love their coffee breaks!

mnemonic: NOVO sounds like NOVA (new star) - something NEW!
grammar_notes: Masculine. Also means 'young' when describing people.
cultural_note: 'O que há de novo?' (What's new?) - casual greeting among friends.

mnemonic: NOVA - like supernova - NEW feminine star!
cultural_note: 'Vida nova' (new life) - Portuguese say this when starting fresh!

mnemonic: VELHO - the LH makes a 'lyuh' sound - OLD things creak!
grammar_notes: Masculine. The 'lh' is like Spanish 'll' or Italian 'gl'.
cultural_note: 'Bairro Alto' (old neighborhood) in Lisbon is famous for nightlife!
tip: For things and people - 'lh' like Spanish ll

mnemonic: VELHA = VEL-yah - the YAH ending for feminine old!
cultural_note: 'Alfama' is Lisbon's velha (old) neighborhood - beautiful historic area!

mnemonic: BONITO sounds like 'bunny-toe' - cute like a bunny's toe!
grammar_notes: Masculine. Works for people things and places.
cultural_note: 'Que bonito!' is a common exclamation when you see something beautiful.
'És muito bonita' is a romantic compliment - use with caution!
